titles.title: Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” (the second half of the year)

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” for the second half of the year (fols. 3ra-192vc) I-1) Mäggabit (fols. 3ra-34va) I-2) Miyazya (fols. 34va-64rc) I-3) Gǝnbot (fols. 64va-97rb) I-4) Säne (fols. 97rb-123vb) I-5) Ḥamle (fols. 123vb-157vb) I-6) Näḥase (fols. 157vc-183rb) I-7) Ṗagwǝmen (fols. 183rb-189va) I-8) Fragment of Ṗagwǝmen (fols. 190ra-192vc) The commemorative notices are followed by ʿarke-hymns
Additio 1.

copyists.copyist: According to the colophon, the scribe is Wäldä Giyorgis (his baptismal name; his worldly mane is däbtära Fänta) of Säqwäṭa Gäbrǝʾel, who was brought up by Wag sǝyyum Bǝrru.

donors.donor: Several individuals are mentioned in the supplication formulas, written in a secondary hand: e.g., ʾabunä Gäbrä Qirqos (e.g., fols. 3ra, 12vb), Wälättä Bǝrhan (e.g., fol. 3ra), ʾAmätä Maryam (e.g., fols. 3va, 7vc), Gäbrä Maryam (e.g., fols. 3vb, 7rb, 9vc), Zärʾa Mäsqäl (e.g., fols. 4rc, 7vb), Habtä Śǝllase (e.g., fols. 5rb, 9ra), Täsfa Śǝllase (e.g., fol. 5rb). The same individuals are also mentioned in Additio 1.

dcomments.dcomment: King Mǝnilǝk (r. 1889-1913) is mentioned, e.g., on fols. 5rb, 7rbc, 7va, 8rc. King Ḫa[y]lä Śǝllase (r. 1930-74) is mentioned on fol. 4rc.

txstates.txstate: Some fols. are stained with dirt. The threads of the sewing are partly modern, synthetic. Several fols. are affected by humidity. The text is partly illegible on fols. 178vc, 179ra. Holes or tears amended, e.g., on fols. 1, 2, 23, 43, 47, 51, 57, 58, 78, 165.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather (two separate pieces sewn together along the middle of the spine). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, x-form, criss-cross).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches on the spine cover close to the head and tail of the codex.

squires.squire:
A(2/s.l.: stub after 1; stub before 2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(12/fols. 3r-14v) – II(11; s.l.: 5, stub after 7/fols. 15r-25v) – III(12/fols. 26r-37v) – IV(12; s.l.: 5, stub after 8; 8, stub after 5/fols. 38r-49v) – V(12; s.l.: 5, stub after 8; 8, stub after 5/fols. 50r-61v) – VI(12/fols. 62r-73v) – VII(12/fols. 74r-84v) – VIII(12; s.l.: 3, stub after 9; 5, stub after 8; 8, stub after 5; 10, stub after 2/fols. 85r-96v) – IX(12; s.l.: 5, stub after (; 8, stub after 5/fols. 97r-108v) – X(12/fols. 109r-120v) – XI(12/fols. 121r-132v) – XII(12; s.l.: 6, stub after 7; 7, stub after 6/fols. 133r-144v) – XIII(12; s.l.: 2, stub after 10; 5, stub after 7; 8, stub after 4; 11, stub after 1/fols. 145r-156v) – XIV(12; s.l.: 4, stub after 8; 9, stub after 3/ fols. 157v-168v) – XV(10/fols. 169r-178v).
The structure of the last quires (XVI, XVII, XVIII ?) cannot be established.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; name of the king; a few lines of the incipit pages of Texts I-1 – I-7, alternating with black lines; incipit of each commemorative notice; the word sälam; elements of Ethiopic numerals; elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers.

colophon.det: The colophon is written in Amharic. It tells that the scribe is Wäldä Giyorgis (his baptismal name; his worldly mane is däbtära Fänta) of Säqwäṭa Gäbrǝʾel, who was brought up by Wag sǝyyum Bǝrru, and that the exemplar was the Synaxarion of Säqwäṭa Gäbrǝʾel.

additional.cont: Fol. 189vb: Register of the donors' names.
additional.det: List of the names of the donors written in red and reddish-brown ink.

extras.extra: - Two strips of parchment originating from another Ms. have been inserted between fols. 1 and 2. - Fols. 190ra-191vc: Fragment of another Synaxarion for the month of Ṗagwǝmen serving as endleaves. The text is partly illegible on fols 191r-v. - Erasures: fols. 5ra, 104ra. - Corrections written over erasures: fols. 10va, 22rc; in recent blue ballpoint pen: fol. 8rc. - Omitted letters or words inserted interlineally: e.g., fols. 69vc, 77va, 78rc, 79va, 81ra. Scribbles and doodles: fols. 151v, 162r, 162v, 163r.
